intro: Adenoropium villosum, commonly known as the hairy adenoropium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Adenoropium villosum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
